    Histology grading - Gleason scale     
    Grades tumors on a scale of 1 through 5
         Scores   2 - 5: Low-grade cancer.
         Scores  6 - 7: Intermediate grade. (majority).
        Scores   8 - 10: High-grade cancer

STAGING
T1  Not palpable: 
    -Incidentally found in post TURP resected tissue or 
    -Identified by needle biopsy done for elevated PSA level
 T2  Palpable- Limited to prostate
 T3 - Extends through the prostatic capsule +/- seminal vesicle invasion
 T4  invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles

TREATMENT
1) Active surveillance:for asymptomatic patients > 70 with:

     - if other life-limiting disorders coexist

2) Gleason grade < 7 and  PSA < 10 ng/L =  potentially curable. 
    - Radical prostatectomy

or

3) High Gleason grade /High PSA/Bone mets = palliative
     a) Hormone therapy

        -  Anti androgens - Flutamide

Bicalutamide (Casodex)

Mosquito vector bites infected human host

Most patients with hyperparathyroidism secondary to chronic kidney disease 
will improve after renal transplantation

but many will continue to have a degree of 
residual hyperparathyroidism (tertiary hyperparathyroidism) post-transplant 
with associated risk of bone loss
the disease will progress to tertiary hyperparathyroidism

i.e. parathyroid gland hypertrophy becomes irreversible.

Medical
1) Treat underlying cause ie. renal transplant
2) Dietary restriction of phosphorus.

3)Vitamin D supplements

 Parathyroidectomy"

"Results from quickly eating or drinking very cold substances.

REFFERED PAIN THEORY:
Glossopharyngeal nerve
This  is sensory to the pharynx

tonsils and also the dura mater. 
When you put your hand into a bucket of ice water
it hurts. In the same way
when you put something cold against your pharynx or palate

you feel pain. 
Your brain  interprets this pain
as coming not from where the ice cream is

but from the dura mater covering your brain. 


The Trigeminal nerve
This transmits the signal to the brain. Since this nerve also senses facial pain

the brain assumes that the signal it receives is coming from your forehead 
and interprets this as a headache. 

VASCULAR THEORY
caused by a dramatic and sudden increase in blood flow through the brain's anterior cerebral artery. "

Description:
"1.Elevate patients hand and ask him to make a fist for about 30 seconds.

 3.Still elevated

the hand is then opened. It should appear blanched.
 4.Ulnar pressure is released and the colour should return in 7 seconds.
 
If color returns as described above

the Allen's test is considered to be "positive."
If color fails to return

the test is considered "negative" and the ulnar artery supply to the hand is not sufficient. The radial artery therefore cannot be safely pricked/cannulated.

Allen's test is also performed prior to heart bypass surgery. 
The radial artery is occasionally used as a conduit for bypass surgery
and its patency lasts longer in comparison to the saphenous veins. "

Description:
"Premalignant condition: 40-fold risk of adenocarcinoma

Male: female = 10:1
Caucasian: African = 5:1

Pathology:
Squamous to columnar metaplasia in lower esophagus-
(an adaptation to chronic acid exposure from reflux )

Treatment 
1) Annual surveillance to detect progression to intraepithelial neoplasia.
2)For such high-grade dysplasia: 
     -  esophagectomy or
     -  endoscopic mucosal ablation 


85% mortality if oesophageal cancer develops."

Most widespread single-gene cause of autism and inherited cause of intellectual disability.

Description:
"-Retention cyst caused by  protein plug blocking outlet of mamamary gland.

-Conatins milk or a milky substance
-Occurs in lactating women on cessation of lactation. 

Treatment
-Once lactation has ended the cyst should resolve without intervention. 

-Attempts to drain the cyst are unsuccessful because the protein plug remains intact and milk production continues. 
-Excision of cyst needed."
